331313=Johnson will be at home opener — 8/10/2006, from TheWolverine.com, 339025=Notes: High school receiver-cornerback plucked out of Michigan after a pair of state championships. Played in just three games as a junior after tearing the ACL and LCL in his right knee. As a true freshman in 2007, played in all 13 games (one start at flanker) and recorded seven receptions for 110 yards (15.7-yard average) and a touchdown, with 25 kickoff returns for 620 yards (24.8-yard average). Played in all 13 games in '08 (two starts at flanker) and caught 33-570-8 (17.3) with 14-380 (27.1) on kickoff returns. Broke his left collarbone during '09 fall camp and missed the first five games. On the season, started 5-of-8 games at split end and pulled in 34-378-3 (11.1), with 13-264 (20.3) on kickoff returns. During '10 spring practice, was bothered by a sprained left elbow and had his right wrist operated on. Started 12-of-13 games at flanker in the fall, producing 64-692-8 (10.8) receiving with 22 punt returns for 312 yards (14.2), including an 89-yard score against Hawaii, and 4-87 (21.8) on kickoff returns. Had 16 career rushes for 88 yards (5.5) and zero TDs. Did not perform shuttles at the Combine after pulling his left hamstring in positional drills., 288373=Trojans down Eagles in Emerald Bowl — 12/27/2009, from USCFootball.com, 292676=Trojan offense leads USC to win — 10/25/2009, from USCFootball.com, 268611=Video Reel 16 — Wednesday, March 31, 2010, 328412=Johnson talks OSU visit (or visits) — 10/23/2006, from BuckeyeGrove.com, 277287=Pendergast sets his sights on Troy — 10/13/2010, from BearTerritory.net, 336056=Big Ten Blitz: Hawkeyes look to the future — 11/29/2005, from Rivals.com Football Recruiting, 291646=Oregon dominates USC defense — 11/1/2009, from USCFootball.com, 265267=Video Reel 1 — Sunday, October 31, 2010, 286092=Time to make these teams 'special' — 3/30/2010, from USCFootball.com, 311667=Trojans invade Virginia, conquer Cavs — 8/30/2008, from USCFootball.com, 314791=Talking Talent: Receiver — 7/31/2008, from IrishIllustrated.com, 278645=Week 3 Watch: Many teams seek validation — 9/13/2010, from Rivals.com College Football, 301130=Scrimmage Insider: Corp goes deep — 4/18/2009, from USCFootball.com, 294901=Shane's Words: Bear hunting — 10/1/2009, from USCFootball.com, 299225=Bradford one exciting story to follow — 7/11/2009, from USCFootball.com, 315477=Words are the base of program philosophies — 6/30/2008, from USCFootball.com, 295404=Practice Insider: Barkley to start vs. Wash. textBeforeTable: Scouting Audibles Bio Videos Statistics Updates Oregon coach Chip Kelly lost his starting quarterback during the spring but hasn't lost since. The Ducks will face Auburn for the BCS title, and that's reason enough for Kelly to be named our Pac-10 coach of the year and lead the Rivals.com All-Pac-10 team. [details] The Latest: Rivals.com 2010 All-Pac-10 team — 12/9/2010   Kris Albarado Joey Augello Jordan Austin Zach Banner Quinn Bassler Kenny Bigelow Matt Boermeester Chris Brown Max Browne Reid Budrovich Kevin Carrasco Jalen Cope-Fitzpatrick Su'a Cravens Justin Davis Lamar Dawson Ryan Dillard Malik Dorton Chuma Edoga Nico Falah Scott Felix Joel Foy Jalen Greene Joe Harding Ajene Harris Chris Hawkins Roy Hemsley Don Hill Michael Hutchings Adoree' Jackson Erick Jepsen Jalen Jones George Katrib Cody Kessler Robby Kolanz Toa Lobendahn Jonathan Lockett Matt Lopes
